intro: Brassica rapa var. oleifera, commonly known as Chinese kale or gai lan, is a leafy green vegetable with thick, dark green stems and broad, dark green leaves. It is native to East Asia and is cultivated for its edible leaves and stems, which are rich in nutrients such as vitamins A and C. The plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and mustard-like odor. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The leaves are typically harvested before the plant bolts, ensuring a tender texture and mild flavor.
